Characteristics[SamplingTime]: Paraffin embedding was performed after one week at the Department of Pathology, Aalborg University Hospital, Denmark, according to current standards.
The FFPE prepared samples were subsequently stored for three weeks at room temperature prior to sample processing and proteome analysis.
Comment[Separation]: separated using an analytical 50 cm reversed phase Acclaim PepMap RSLC C18 column (Dionex)
Comment[AcquisitionMethod]: selecting up to 12 precursor ions with a mass window of m/z 1.6 based on highest intensity for HCD fragmenting

Characteristics[SamplingTime]: stored at room temperature for 24 h followed by storage at −80 °C for one month prior to sample processing and proteome analysis.

Comment[AcquisitionMethod]: selecting up to 12 precursor ions with a mass window of m/z 1.6 based on highest intensity for HCD fragmenting
